content.text: Maintenance holes are preferred over hand holes as they provide greater flexibility for extension and  expansion of the installed cabling infrastructure e.g. additional pathways.

Maintenance holes and hand holes should be provided at both ends of a conduit route, positioned as close  as practicable (normally within 5 m) to the external building walls and adjacent to the equipment room in  which the cables terminate.
Maintenance holes should be located at the sides of crossings of roadways or railways.
